text: {{Infobox writer | name = Glenn O'Brien | honorific_prefix = | honorific_suffix = | image = Glenn O'Brien 8834.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = | native_name = | native_name_lang = | pseudonym = | birth_name = | birth_date = March 2, 1947 | birth_place = Cleveland, Ohio, U.S. | death_date = April 7, 2017 (aged 70) | death_place = Manhattan, New York, U.S. | resting_place = | occupation = Writer | language = | nationality = American | ethnicity = | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = Georgetown University and Columbia Graduate School of Arts and Sciences | period = | genre = | subject = | movement = | notableworks = | spouse = Gina Nanni (until his death) | partner = | children = | relatives = | awards = named one of Top 10 Most Stylish Men in America by GQ Magazine | signature = | signature_alt = | years_active = | module = | website = | portaldisp = }} Glenn O'Brien (March 2, 1947 - April 7, 2017) was an American writer, largely on the subjects of art, music and fashion. He was featured for many years as "The Style Guy" in GQ magazine, and published a book with that title. He was known for being part of The Factory with Andy Warhol. He has worked as an editor at different magazines, and published the arts and literature magazine Bald Ego from 2003-2005. From 1978 to 1982, O'Brien hosted a New York city Public-access television cable TV show called TV Party.
